file_content.text: It has been a very great pleasure working with you, Major. You are a true credit to the Republic.
I thank you for your service, Major. Your help has made a great difference.
It has been a pleasure making your acquaintance, Major.
Travel cautiously, my friend.
Before you go into Gormak territory, be warned--I've heard talk of Gormak sharpshooters defending the area.
Due to the incredible range of their weapons, they've given the Voss commandos no end of trouble.
If you manage to track those Gormak down, the Voss would be doubly impressed. You should consider it--keeping in mind the risk.
I'll take them out--no problem.
They're as good as gone.
If I spot any sharpshooters, I'll take them out.
I'll keep my eyes open.
Please be cautious--their rifles have claimed many lives.
If you succeed, take their rifles to Mir-ki, a Voss commando stationed in the area. I suspect he'll be very pleased.
Good luck, my friend.
I'm really not interested in your side projects, Koru.
Another waste of time.
Do as you wish. But if you do choose to hunt the sharpshooters, take their rifles to Mir-ki, a Voss commando stationed in the area.
Mir-ki would be very pleased to see this particular Gormak threat ended once and for all. Please consider it, Major--farewell.
Welcome back, Major.
Travel safely, Major.
Koru Tama? Senator Evran said I should speak with you.
Oh, you're that soldier he mentioned. Yes, tell me, do you have any interest in ancient history? Archaeology?
What's this all about, sir?
Why do you ask?
It's important to learn from the past.
I do.
I agree. I think it's a fascinating field of study, personally.
I'm a soldier, not a historian.
Don't waste my time.
That's unfortunate. Military history is a truly fascinating area of study.
Much of Voss's history is unknown. The ruins of their early civilization lie at the foot of the mountain, where you intend to travel.
You have a mission, I know, but if you could recover items of interest from the ruins, we could show the Voss our commitment to their culture. Are you interested?
If it helps the Republic cause, I'll do it.
I'm here to serve.
Fantastic! Sadoll, one of my associates at the Republic outpost in the area, will take delivery of any items you find.
We'll see if there's time.
I would appreciate any time you could spare for our cause.
Not a chance.
Surely diplomacy counts as an important objective, too?
If you find the time, an associate of mine at the Republic outpost will gladly collect your findings. His name is Sadoll.
Good luck, Major!
Greetings, Major. Senator Evran is expecting you.
